title: Taxpayers 'hung out to dry' as they pay for washing machine for John Bercow's nanny
text:
Taxpayers have found themselves rinsed by John Bercow, after they paid a £490 bill for a new washing machine in his nanny’s flat.

The public also paid £1,000 to fix doors in his grace-and-favour home, as well as providing a Christmas tree for his Parliamentary residence.

The costs of maintenance at the Speaker's residence over the past 16 months were disclosed after a FOI request.

Maintenance costs for the past 16 months were revealed alongside a letter from the Department of Finance confirming a new washing machine would be installed in "Speakers nannies flat".
